summary._overviewComment: This tutorial demonstrates how to create a simple message flow for reading data from an OPC server using the OPC-UA-Read Node.

details.details: This tutorial assumes you have installed and configured AppConnect for Manufacturing. If this is not the case, the tutorial has a pre-requisites section which will help you to complete the required tasks before running the tutorial.

After creating a DataSource connection to an OPCServer and starting the Integration Server, you can import a provided application project. The project contains two message flows: a Control Flow and a Read Flow.
After performing some configuration, you will first deploy and start the control flow. Next you will deploy and start the read flow.
The read flow is driven using HTTP data which causes the flow to exexute, read data from the OPC UA Server using the OPC-UA-Read node and return it back to the waiting HTTP client.

sections.section: Click Import and the TestReadFlowApp and ControlFlowApp application will be imported into your workspace.
The TestReadMessageFlow message flow will be opened for you.
Create a Data Source connection to an OPC Server using the App Connect Enterprise Toolkit:

details.details: To create a data source, complete the following steps.
Navigate to the Manufacturing Perspective > DataSources. Specify a name for the mapping node and click OK. The new data source gets created under the DataSource Properties window.
Select the Server URL Type as Endpoint
Specify the Server URL: e.g. opc.tcp://TEST_OPC_SERVER:port/OPCUA/SimulationServer
Select the default values for the rest of the parameters and click on Create DataSource

Assuming you are using a Windows platform, open an App Connect Enterprise Command Console and start an integration server using the following command:
IntegrationServer --work-dir C:\TESTSERVER --name TESTSERVER --admin-rest-api 7600 --http-port-number 7800 --console-log
where C:\TESTSERVER is a folder on your file system that the server will use for its working directory.
Modify C:\TESTSERVER\server.conf.yaml to add the following lines after the line ConnectorProviders:
Please note that you would need to change the jarsURL value as per your installation of ACMFG. But it should point to the amd64_nt_4 folder

ACMfg: connectorClassName: 'com.ibm.industrypack.industryclient.connector.ICConnectorFactory' jarsURL: 'C:\Program Files\IBM\ACMfg\3.0.1.0\runtime\amd64_nt_4' property1: 'trustCertificate=true;allowEndpointMismatch=true'
property2: 'isHA=true;discardData=false;mqttHostName=localhost;mqttPort=11883'
Save the above server.conf.yaml file and restart the Integration server using the command mentioned above

In the App Connect Enterprise Toolkit Integration Explorer view, right click the folder and select the menu item . In the connection details panel, specify the Host name to be localhost, the Port to be 7600 and click Finish. This will connect your Toolkit and display the integration server that you started in the last step

overview.name: Run
overview.heading: Configure and Test the Read Message flow to read from OPC Server and complete the tutorial

details.details: Open the TestReadFlow.msgflow. You will see 3 nodes: 'HTTP Input' , 'OPC-UA-Read', and 'HTTP Reply'
Click on OPC-UA-Read node to open the OPC-UA-Read Node properties.
From the properties window, click on the 'Add' button to open into Manufacturing perspective.
Select the appropriate 'Data source' created in the Pre-Requisite section .
Click on 'Refresh Source Item Tree' to load the Source Items. Select the node from the source tree for which you want to read data
From the 'Client Items' tree, right-click on the 'Item' node and select 'Add Mapping Node'
Specify a name for the node and click 'Ok'
Click on 'Create Client Item' from the 'Client Item Properties' tab
Click on 'Add Client Item to Read' from the 'Select' window at the bottom .
Save the flow
Please make sure you are connected to an Integration Server as described in the PreRequisite section
From the Application Development Tab , under the ControlFlowApp-->Flows, right-click the TestControlFlow.msgflow and select 'Deploy' .
From the 'Integration Server Select the Integration Server that you have started Click 'Finish' on the Deploy window.
Click 'Ok' on the Confirm Window. Once the 'The task completed successfully' message is seen, close the 'Progress Information' window.
Please make sure you are connected to an Integration Server as described in the PreRequisite section
From the Application Development Tab , under the TestReadFlowApp-->Flows, right-click the TestReadFlow.msgflow and select 'Deploy' .
From the 'Integration Server Select the Integration Server that you selected earlier for Control Flow .Click 'Finish' on the Deploy window.
Click 'Ok' on the Confirm Window. Once the 'The task completed successfully' message is seen, close the 'Progress Information' window.

Open a browser window and paste the following in the url: 'http://TESTSERVER:HTTPPORT/TestReadFlow' where TESTSERVER and HTTPPORT are specified when creating the Integration server in the PreRequisite section
Browser output should display the values read from the OPC server in case of successful operation.
